t: Mark 7
Defilement Comes from Within
Then*p the Pharisees and some of the scribes came together to Him, having come from Jerusalem.
Now when they saw some of His disciples eat bread with defiled, that is, with unwashed hands, they found fault.
For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they wash their*i hands in a special way, holding the tradition of the elders.

When*i they*i come*i from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. And there are many other things which they have received and hold, like*i the washing of cups, pitchers, copper vessels, and couches.
Then*p the Pharisees and scribes asked Him, “Why do Your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashed hands?”

He*p answered and said to them, “Well*r did*r Isaiah*r prophesy*r of*r you*r hypocrites,*r as*r it*r is*r written:*r ‘This*rpn people*r honors*r Me*r with*r their*ir lips,*r But*rld their*r heart*r is*r far*r from*r Me.*r
And*rld in*r vain*r they*r worship*r Me,*r Teaching*rld as*ir doctrines*r the*r commandments*r of*r men.’*r
For*rp laying*r aside*r the*r commandment*r of*r God,*r you*r hold*r the*r tradition*r of*r men*r —the*r washing*r of*r pitchers*r and*r cups,*r and*r many*r other*r such*r things*r you*r do.”*r
He*p said to them, “All*ir too*ir well*r you*r reject*r the*r commandment*r of*r God,*r that*r you*r may*r keep*r your*r tradition.*r
For*r Moses*r said,*r ‘Honor*r your*r father*r and*r your*r mother’;*r and,*r ‘He*r who*r curses*r father*r or*r mother,*r let*r him*r be*r put*r to*r death.’*r
But*r you*r say,*r ‘If*r a*r man*r says*r to*r his*r father*r or*r mother,*r “Whatever*r profit*r you*r might*r have*r received*r from*r me*r is*ir Corban”—’*r (that*r is,*r a*r gift*r to*ir God),*ir
then*r you*r no*r longer*r let*r him*r do*r anything*r for*r his*r father*r or*r his*r mother,*r
making*r the*r word*r of*r God*r of*r no*r effect*r through*r your*r tradition*r which*r you*r have*r handed*r down.*r And*r many*r such*r things*r you*r do.”*r
When*p He had called all the multitude to Himself,*i He said to them, “Hear*r Me,*r everyone,*r and*r understand:*r

There*r is*r nothing*r that*r enters*r a*r man*r from*r outside*r which*r can*r defile*r him;*r but*r the*r things*r which*r come*r out*r of*r him,*r those*r are*r the*r things*r that*r defile*r a*r man.*r
If*r anyone*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear!”*r
When*p He had entered a house away from the crowd, His disciples asked Him concerning the parable.
So He said to them, “Are*r you*r thus*r without*r understanding*r also?*r Do*r you*r not*r perceive*r that*r whatever*r enters*r a*r man*r from*r outside*r cannot*r defile*r him,*r
because*r it*r does*r not*r enter*r his*r heart*r but*r his*r stomach,*r and*r is*r eliminated,*r thus*ir purifying*r all*r foods?”*r
And He said, “What*r comes*r out*r of*r a*r man,*r that*r defiles*r a*r man.*r
For*r from*r within,*r out*r of*r the*r heart*r of*r men,*r proceed*r evil*r thoughts,*r adulteries,*r fornications,*r murders,*r
thefts,*r covetousness,*r wickedness,*r deceit,*r lewdness,*r an*r evil*r eye,*r blasphemy,*r pride,*r foolishness.*r
All*r these*r evil*r things*r come*r from*r within*r and*r defile*r a*r man.”*r
A Gentile Shows Her Faith
From*p there He arose and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon. And He entered a house and wanted no one to know it,*i but He could not be hidden.
For a woman whose young daughter had an unclean spirit heard about Him, and she came and fell at His feet.
The woman was a Greek, a Syro-Phoenician by birth, and she kept asking Him to cast the demon out of her daughter.
But Jesus said to her, “Let*r the*r children*r be*r filled*r first,*r for*r it*r is*r not*r good*r to*r take*r the*r children’s*r bread*r and*r throw*r it*ir to*r the*r little*r dogs.”*r
And*p she answered and said to Him, “Yes, Lord, yet even the little dogs under the table eat from the children’s crumbs.”
Then*p He said to her, “For*r this*r saying*r go*r your*r way;*r the*r demon*r has*r gone*r out*r of*r your*r daughter.”*r
And*p when she had come to her house, she found the demon gone out, and her daughter lying on the bed.
Jesus Heals a Deaf-Mute
Again,*p departing from the region of Tyre and Sidon, He came through the midst of the region of Decapolis to the Sea of Galilee.
Then they brought to Him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech, and they begged Him to put His hand on him.
And He took him aside from the multitude, and put His fingers in his ears, and He spat and touched his tongue.
Then, looking up to heaven, He sighed, and said to him, “Ephphatha,”*r that is, “Be*r opened.”*r
Immediately*p his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was loosed, and he spoke plainly.
Then He commanded them that they should tell no one; but the more He commanded them, the more widely they proclaimed it.*i
And they were astonished beyond measure, saying, “He has done all things well. He makes both the deaf to hear and the mute to speak.”
